 Bitboard with just the above-top row filled in.

Detailed Description

Representation of a game of Connect Four optimized for the traditional 7x6 board size.

This class uses two longs as bitboards for the respective players such that the bits are represented in the following manner:

................... -= TOP
5.12.19.26.33.40.47
4.11.18.25.32.39.46
3.10.17.24.31.38.45
2..9.16.23.30.37.44
1..8.15.22.29.36.43
0..7.14.21.28.35.42 -= BOTTOM

A bit is set to one it the player has a coin in that position.

See also:
GameStateModule
Author:
Leonid Shamis

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GameState_Opt7x6.GameState_Opt7x6 (  ) 

Primary Constructor.

Creates a new game board of the specified width and height. The starting player is player 1 and the board is initially empty and with no undo/redo history. Width and Height are preset.

int GameState_Opt7x6.getAt ( final int  x,
final int  y 
)

Returns what coin is at the given location.

Returns the value of the coin at position (x, y). If there is no coin, the return value is 0; otherwise it is the 1-based index of the player who placed the coin there.

Parameters:
x The x coordinate to look up.
y The y coordinate to look up.
Returns:
The value of the coin at the given position, or 0 if not present.

Definition at line 226 of file GameState_Opt7x6.java.

int GameState_Opt7x6.getWinner (  ) 

Return the winner of the current game.

Returns the index of the winning player. If player 1 wins, the return value is 1. If player 2 wins, the return value is 2. On a draw, the return value is 0. If this function is called and the game is not over, throws a RuntimeException.

Returns:
The index of the winning player.
Exceptions:
RuntimeException If the game is not over.
See also:
isGameOver

Implements GameStateModule.

Definition at line 159 of file GameState_Opt7x6.java.

void GameState_Opt7x6.makeMove ( final int  x  ) 

Makes the specified move for the active player.

Makes the specified move for the active player. This updates the game history and can be undone with unMakeMove. If the move is illegal, throws a RuntimeException exception.

Parameters:
x The move to be made.
Exceptions:
RuntimeException If the move is illegal.
See also:
unMakeMove

Implements GameStateModule.

Definition at line 136 of file GameState_Opt7x6.java.

void GameState_Opt7x6.unMakeMove (  ) 

Undoes the most recent action.

Undoes the last action performed by makeMove. This function can be called multiple successive times, but no more than the number of times that makeMove has been called.

See also:
makeMove

Implements GameStateModule.
